description.raw:
This is needed by pull request #111 in order to send new and erased entities to the ign-gui.
I have refactored some of the code so it might be easier to review this by changesets:

* ce68a4e: Use ISystemConfigure for SceneBroadcaster to initialize the world Id and name.

* 949b04d: Create a topic for publishing a scene with new entities.

    This uses EachNew to create a scene message consisting of only new entities. This changeset also introduces a change in the content of the scene graph in `SceneBroadcaster`.  The data in each node is now the message associated with that entity only. i.e, a model node only has a message only about the model. It will not have any links, joints, etc. To create a the whole scene, one has to traverse the whole graph adding messages as necessary.

* f64d08a: Add topic to notify clients when entities get deleted

    Currently only model entities are supported for deletion

* 3e09413: Refactor free functions in SceneBroadcaster to be static member functions so they can use graph type alias

  • ce68a4e: Use ISystemConfigure for SceneBroadcaster to initialize the world Id and name.

  • 949b04d: Create a topic for publishing a scene with new entities.

    This uses EachNew to create a scene message consisting of only new entities. This changeset also introduces a change in the content of the scene graph in SceneBroadcaster. The data in each node is now the message associated with that entity only. i.e, a model node only has a message only about the model. It will not have any links, joints, etc. To create a the whole scene, one has to traverse the whole graph adding messages as necessary.

  • f64d08a: Add topic to notify clients when entities get deleted

    Currently only model entities are supported for deletion

  • 3e09413: Refactor free functions in SceneBroadcaster to be static member functions so they can use graph type alias
